alert.note: Alert for Carter; Johnston; Love; Marshall; Murray (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 11 at 5:14AM CDT until July 11 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Love County in southern Oklahoma... Southeastern Carter County in southern Oklahoma... Northwestern Marshall County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 514 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Gene Autry to 4 miles southeast of Lone Grove, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Madill, Tishomingo, Lone Grove, Dickson, Mannsville, Springer, Ravia, Wapanucka, Mill Creek, Milburn, Dougherty, Bromide, Gene Autry, Overbrook, Reagan, Lake Murray, Russett, Lake Of The Arbuckles, and northwestern Lake Texoma. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
